bboxes.raw_text:
BUFFALO, NY. : Members
of the Buffalo Branch NAACP
picketed the annual Auto Show
here in protest against the re-
fusal of General Motors Corpo-
ration officials to discuss dis
criminatory employment and up
grading practices at its five
plants in this area.


Donald Lee, branch labor COM
mittee chairman. said, the pick
citing which began when the Auto
Show opened January 8, was to
inform the public of GINS UNI
willingness to talk with the
NAACP.


Mr.. Lee said an investigation
of employment and upgrading
practices at GINS four Chevro-
let plants and one Harrison Rad
iator Company found Negroes
either completely ignored or ac-"
cepted in the skilled trades, white
collar jobs and supervisory posi-
tons.


The branch has been demon
strating against GIN plants and
dealers in the Buffalo area since
September in an effort to get a
conference with corporation Of
ficials.

A fight between a white STU
dent and a Negro student at a
lunch stand near Phoenix Union
High School, touched off bar
rage of rumors of race riot
on Wed. Jan. is.


School principal Earl McCullar
said the incident was spread by
those who never discuss the mer-
it's of the school or students.


The incident occurred when the
shite student laid two nickels on
top of a pinball machine. He
turned away and when he looked
back the nickels had disappeared.
He recovered one coin and &C
cused a Negro boy Of taking
another. One Negro student re-
turned one of the coins. A fight
began and the security police
brought order.


Mr.. McCullar urged parents to
insist their children stay on the
school grounds and eat instead OF
visiting the lunch stands. He said
out of school youths gather there
and cause trouble.

RALEIGH, NC. = Gov. Terry
Sanford said he would hinder
attempts to make the college town
of Chapel Hill an "open city,"
He spoke directly against COM
ments Of James Farmer, CORE
national director, who stated his
group would make an all out drive
to integrate the domestic Of the
University of North Carolina.


Farmer denied charges that his
group would lead any violent ac-
ton, but said nonWolent methods
would be increased.


GIVE TO THE


MARCH OF DIMES

GOVERNOR TO HINDER
OPEN CITY PLAN

The Texas Highway Department
changed it's name and provided
$4,000 for reconditioning work
on the road yesterday. It's the
first time a "No. l" designation
has been used by the department.

The monthly meeting the home Of Dr. Flor
ence Jewell 1905 Members enjoyed delicious
turkey dinner.


Dr. Clara Jackson chairman Dr. Bertha Mathews is
the reporter.


Pictured Curry, ILL., Comm, Susie Gray, FIG FL
Swtnda deputy Clara Jackson Ophels Tapp Blanche
Lizzie Barber, McCee Lillian White Flor
ence Jewell Lydia Lille JONES' Bertha Mathews Dezora
Pttnan, Hattie Scott and Ollie M Christopher.

"Ranch Road l" is the new
designation for winding l2-mile
route along the Pedernales river
to President Johnson S ranch, 65
miles west of Austin.
